channel.title: Charts on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Charts on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Creating and Customizing Charts
item.description: It is possible to add a variety of charts to spreadsheets with Aspose.Cells. Aspose.Cells provides many flexible charting objects. This topic discusses Aspose.Cells’ charting objects. Contents Summary 1 Creating Charts 1.1 Things to Know Before Creating a Chart 1.1.1 Charting Objects 1.1.2 Using Charting Objects 1.2 Create Chart Using Aspose.Cells 1.2.1 Pyramid Chart 1.2.2 Line Chart 1.2.3 Bubble Chart 1.2.4 Line with Data Marker Chart 2 Creating Custom Charts

item.title: Setting Chart Appearance
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Setting Chart Appearance 1.1 Setting Chart Area 1.2 Setting Chart Lines 1.3 Applying Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 Themes to Charts 1.4 Setting the Titles of Charts or Axes 1.5 Working with Major Gridlines 1.5.1 Hiding Major Gridlines 1.5.2 Changing Major Gridlines Settings | Setting Chart Appearance In How to Create a Chart we gave a brief introduction to the types of charts and charting objects offered by Aspose.

item.title: Manipulate Position Size and Designer Chart
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Chart Position and Size 1.1 Controlling Chart Position and Size 2 Manipulating Designer Charts 2.1 Manipulating Designer Charts in Template Files 2.1.1 Creating a Chart 2.1.2 Manipulating the Chart 2.1.3 Manipulating a Line Chart in the Designer Template | Chart Position and Size Sometimes, you want to change the position or size of the new or existing chart inside the worksheet.

item.title: Using Sparklines and Settings 3D Format
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Using Sparklines 1.1 Sparklines in Microsoft Excel 1.2 Sparklines using Aspose.Cells 2 Setting 3D Format | Using Sparklines Microsoft Excel 2010 can analyze information in more ways than ever before. It allows users to track and highlight important data trends with new data analysis and visualization tools. Sparklines are mini-charts that you can place inside cells so that you can view data and chart on the same table.

item.title: Chart Rendering
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Creating Charts 2 Rendering Charts 2.1 Rendering Charts to Images 2.2 Rendering Chart to PDF 3 Supported Chart Types for Rendering | Creating Charts Aspose.Cells APIs support to create a verity of Excel charts as detailed under the topic Creating & Customizing Excel Charts. In order to demonstrate the usage of Aspose.Cells APIs to render the charts in image & PDF format, we will create a chart of type Column as per the following snippet.

item.title: Chart Types
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Chart Types 2.1 Standard Types 2.1.1 Column Charts 2.1.2 Bar Charts 2.1.3 Line Charts 2.1.4 Pie Charts 2.1.5 Scatter Charts 2.1.6 Area Charts 2.1.7 Doughnut Charts 2.1.8 Surface 3D Charts 2.1.9 Bubble Charts 2.1.10 Stock Charts 2.1.11 Cylinder Charts 2.1.12 Cone Charts 2.1.13 Pyramid Charts 2.2 Custom Chart Types | Introduction A chart is a visual display of information.

item.title: Controls in Charts
item.description: Sometimes you need to insert drawing objects like labels, text boxes, pictures and so on into a chart. Aspose.Cells can add the controls to a chart at runtime. Contents Summary 1 Adding Label Control to the Chart 2 Adding TextBox Control to the Chart 3 Adding Picture to the Chart 4 Adding Checkbox in the Chart | Adding Label Control to the Chart Labels provide a means for giving information to users about a spreadsheet’s content.

item.title: Data Formatting in Charts
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Setting Chart Data 1.1 Chart Data 1.2 Category Data | In our previous topics, we have already provided many examples to demonstrate that how can you set a data source for your chart but in this topic, we are going to provide more details about the types of data that can be set for a chart. Setting Chart Data

item.title: Read and Manipulate Excel 2016 Charts
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Read and Manipulate Excel 2016 Charts 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output || Possible Usage Scenarios Aspose.Cells now supports the reading and manipulation of Microsoft Excel 2016 charts which are not present in Microsoft Excel 2013 or earlier versions. Read and Manipulate Excel 2016 Charts The following sample code loads the source excel file which contains Excel 2016 charts in the first worksheet.

item.title: Set the Values Format Code of Chart Series
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Set the Values Format Code of Chart Series 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can set the values format code of chart series using the Series.ValuesFormatCode property. This property is not only useful for the series which is based on the range inside the worksheet but also works well for the series created with an array of values.

item.title: Set the Shape Type of Data Labels of Chart
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Set the Shape Type of Data Labels of Chart 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can change the shape type of data labels of the chart using the DataLabels.ShapeType property. It takes the value of DataLabelShapeType enumeration and changes the shape type of data labels accordingly. Some of its values are

item.title: Handle Automatic Units of Chart Axis like Microsoft Excel
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Handle Automatic Units of Chart Axis like Microsoft Excel 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Early versions of Aspose.Cells were not able to handle automatic units of the chart axis properly when the chart is rendered to image or PDF. Now, Aspose.Cells supports the handling of automatic units of the chart axis.

item.title: Read Axis Labels after Calculating the Chart
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Read Axis Labels after Calculating the Chart 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios You can read axis labels of your chart after calculating its values using the Chart.Calculate() method. Please use the Axis.AxisLabels property for this purpose that will return the list of axis labels. Read Axis Labels after Calculating the Chart

item.title: Create Chart PDF with Desired Page Size
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Create Chart PDF with Desired Page Size 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can create chart Pdf with your desired page size using Aspose.Cells and specify how you want to align the chart inside the page as top, bottom, center, left, right etc. Besides, the output chart can be created in stream or on disk.

item.title: Find Type of X and Y Values of Points in Chart Series
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Find Type of X and Y Values of Points in Chart Series 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometime, you want to know the type of X and Y values of chart points in a series. Aspose.Cells provides ChartPoint.XValueType and ChartPoint.YValueType properties that can be used for this purpose.

item.title: Read Chart Subtitle from ODS File
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Read Chart Subtitle from ODS File 1.1 Sample Code 1.2 Console Output | Read Chart Subtitle from ODS File Aspose.Cells provides you with the ability to read chart subtitles in ODS files by using the Chart.SubTitle property. The following sample code loads the sample ODS file and reads the chart subtitle using Chart.SubTitle property and prints it in the Console Window.

item.title: Change Tick Label Direction
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Change Tick Label Direction 1.1 Source file image 1.2 Output file image 2 Sample Code | Change Tick Label Direction Aspose.Cells provides you with the ability to change the chart tick label direction by using the TickLabels.DirectionType property. The TickLabels.DirectionType property accepts the ChartTextDirectionType enumeration value. The ChartTextDirectionType enumeration provides the following members Horizontal Vertical Rotate90 Rotate270 Stacked The following image compares the source and output files
